publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-11 10:28:02 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Provenance unknown, but we have reason to believe it was donated by Donated by Pacific Street Films in circa 1990. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1950.016 and 1950.162.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pacific Street Films (PSF) is an independent film company that began producing social and political documentary films in 1969. It began its corporate life as the Pacific Street Film Collective, and its founders were active in the student anti-war movement during the late 1960s and early 1970s. Politically they identified themselves as anarchists, and PSF has produced several films on anarchism, including Free Voice of Labor--The Jewish Anarchists (1980), and Anarchism in America (1982).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This is an unprocessed collection of the records of Pacific Street Films.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Pacific Street Films was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
